assetsDir.description:
Folder inside the  {@link  publicDir }  folder where Triplex maintains static assets such as GLTF and GLB files. Files inside this directory are made available to be added to the open component as a `<primitive>` element.

Defaults to `"assets"`.

components.description: An array of relative glob paths to select what files can be added to other components. You can define multiple roots.

define.description: Variables that are replaced when running your scenes. Works exactly the same as the `define` option in Vite or the `DefinePlugin` in Webpack.

files.description: An array of relative path globs to select what files can be opened by Triplex. You can define multiple roots. Found files will be available to open in the `File` > `Open` menu.

provider.description: Path to a provider component that can hold all React providers needed during runtime. The component must be the default export and return children.

publicDir.description: Relative path to a folder used to expose files through the local dev server, such as images, videos, and GLTF/GLB files. For example if the public directory has a `image.png` file then it will be made available at the `"/image.png"` URL.

rendererAttributes.description: Extra attributes passed to the renderer. For available attributes refer to the docs.
